alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Elmore (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Elmore and southeastern Coosa Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 446 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pentonville, or near Rockford, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Equality, Speed, Pentonville, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Cottage Grove, Nixburg, Titus, Western Lake Martin, Fishpond, Hissop and Ray. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
